node.statement: Step 1.4.3 (Root-of-unity truncation â€” Turaev-Viro): When q = exp(2 pi i / r) is a primitive root of unity, the representation theory of U_q(su(2)) truncates: spins are bounded by j <= (r-2)/2. The quantum 6j symbols become the building blocks of the Turaev-Viro state sum TV_r(M) = sum_{colorings} prod_{edges} dim_q(j_e) prod_{tetrahedra} {6j}_q, which is a topological invariant of the 3-manifold M. This is the q-deformation of the (formal) Ponzano-Regge sum.
